requirement.topic: XmlBlaster provides a plugin possibility for its persistence layer
requirement.description:
To store messages from xmlBlaster and to restore them again after a new startup of the server there is a lightweight interface, called I_PersitenceDriver, available. You may supply your own persistence layer, which for example stores the messages in a database like Oracle, PostgreSQL or Ozone, or wherever you like.
Currently we only provide a very simple file based store, called FileDriver, which may be used as a reference implementation to your own persistency.
Writing an own persistence layer is very easy:
1. Implement the I_PersitenceDriver interface (look into FileDriver how you could do it).
2. Register the driver with xmlBlaster through the xmlBlaster.properties file with the Persistence.* variables.
Note that this interface is very likely to change in one of the next xmlBlaster releases, since it is to simple too support caching.
